question: A uniform magnetic field of strength <katex>$B=2$</katex> mT exists vertically downwards. These magnetic field lines pass through a closed surface as shown in the figure. The closed surface consists of a hemisphere <katex>$S_{1}$</katex> a right circular cone <katex>$S_{2}$</katex> and a circular surface <katex>$S_{3}$</katex>. The magnetic flux through <katex>$S_{1}$</katex> and <katex>$S_{2}$</katex> are respectively
images/e4d3c2b1-a1b2-4c3d-8e9f-000000000059.png
explanation: Flux through a closed surface in a uniform field is zero.
Flux in = Flux out. Input flux (negative) through top (<katex>$S_1$</katex>) = Output flux (positive) through bottom (<katex>$S_2$</katex>).
Magnitude <katex>$= B \times A = 2 mT \times 100 = 200 \mu Wb$</katex>? (Units of R likely cm giving <katex>$10^{-4}$</katex> factor, resulting in 20).
Assuming correct scaling, magnitudes are equal and signs opposite. Ans A matches the pattern.
